stories.text:
I worry more about loving money than making money. I am 50 and just paid my mortgage off. I have a year's worth of salary in savings. In 17 years I will get a UK state pension and then some.

Does anyone coming from a similar perspective have a framework for saving? In particular what you hope to achieve for retirement?
stories.title: Ask HN: Non-money lovers, what do you hope to achieve for retirement?
I have been tracking my time for 4 years, and here is what I learned
Italians wait for rain where longest river runs dry
A fast accurate code counter with complexity calculations and COCOMO estimates
Artist Behind Banana Taped to Wall Can’t Escape Copyright Suit
CEO Arrested for Selling $1B in Fake Cisco Hardware on Amazon, eBay
Did Russian hackers blow up a Texas LNG pipeline on June 8?
German utility Uniper requests government rescue after Russian gas squeeze

stories.text:
Since HN’s come back online, I am randomly been getting an error message saying, “We're having some trouble serving your request. Sorry” and have seen others on Twitter sharing getting the same error.

Does anyone know easy/free way to log HN not being down, but returning an availability error — preferably from a system that’s not dependent on AWS; HN is currently on AWS as a result of the main & fallback servers experiencing disk failures.

Preferably it generate a report that publicly available like the one below, but that report doesn’t appear to log these types of errors:

https://hn.hund.io/
stories.title: Ask HN: “We're having some trouble serving your request. Sorry”
